2:
both low and high,
\q rich and poor together.
3:
My mouth will speak wisdom
\q and the meditation of my heart will be of understanding.
\q
5:
Why should I fear the days of evil,
\q when iniquity surrounds me at my heels?
6:
Why should I fear those who trust in their wealth
\q and boast about the amount of their riches?
\q
7:
It is certain that no one can redeem his brother
\q or give God a ransom for him,
\q
8:
For the redemption of one's life is costly,
\q and no one can pay what we owe.
9:
No one can live forever
\q so that his body should not decay.
\q
11:
Their inner thought is that their families will
continue forever,
\q and the places where they live, to all generations;
\q they call their lands after their own names.
14:
Like sheep they are appointed for Sheol,
\q and death will be their shepherd.
\q The upright will rule over them in the morning,
\q and their bodies will be consumed in Sheol,
\q with no place for them to live.
\q
16:
Do not be afraid when one becomes rich,
\q and the glory of his house increases.
\q
17:
For when he dies he will take nothing away;
\q his glory will not go down after him.
18:
He blessed his soul while he lived—
\q and men praise you when you live for yourself—
\q
19:
he will go to the generation of his fathers
\q and they will never see the light again.
\q
20:
One who has wealth but no understanding
\q is like the beasts, which perish.
49:
\m
\d For the chief musician. A psalm of the sons of Korah.
\q
